paper_title: CT-1 Q.P& Key batch 8 am exam - Internal Assessment - I (CLA1-T1)

questions.question_text:
The crystal field splitting energy of an octahedral complex is 18,000 cm⁻¹. What will be the energy in terms of Δ₀?
a) 40,500 cm⁻¹
b) 8100 cm⁻¹
c) 36,000 cm⁻¹
d) 9000 cm⁻¹
questions.chapter: Unit 1: Coordination Chemistry - Crystal Field Theory

questions.question_text:
The number of unpaired electrons present in [Fe(CN)₆]⁴⁻ is
a) 0
b) 1
c) 2
d) 3

Arrange the following ligands, en, NH₃, H₂O and CN⁻ in their decreasing order of field strength
a) NH₃ > CN⁻ > H₂O > en
b) en > CN⁻ > H₂O > NH₃
c) CN⁻ > en > NH₃ > H₂O
d) CN⁻ > en > H₂O > NH₃

The complexes [Co(NH₃)₆][Cr(C₂O₄)₃] and [Cr(NH₃)₆][Co(C₂O₄)₃]
(a) Linkage isomerism
(b) Geometrical isomerism
(c) Coordination isomerism
(d) Ionisation isomerism

The shielding constant of 1s electron in helium atom is _____
a) 1.70
b) 0.35
c) 1.65
d) 0.30
Discuss the salient features of crystal field theory.
questions.answer: Important features of CFT - 4 Points - 4 Marks
questions.chapter: Unit 1: Coordination Chemistry - Crystal Field Theory

questions.question_text:
Identify the complex possessing the larger value of Δ₀ in the following pairs and give reason.
(A) [Ni(CN)₆]⁴⁻ and [Ni(H₂O)₆]²⁺
(B) [Co(H₂O)₆]²⁺ and [Co(H₂O)₆]³⁺
(C) [Rh(NH₃)₆]³⁺ and [Ir(NH₃)₆]³⁺
questions.answer: Explanation for the high value of Δ₀ in each pair- 2 Marks - (3x2 = 6 Marks)
questions.chapter: Unit 1: Coordination Chemistry - Crystal Field Stabilization Energy

questions.question_text: Discuss the crystal field splitting of a tetrahedral complex. Calculate the CFSE and magnetic moment of [NiCl₄]²⁻ (Atomic number of Ni is 28).
questions.answer: Crystal Field Splitting Diagram- 2 Marks, Explanation on d – orbitals splitting – 4 Marks, CFSE calculation - 2 Marks Magnetic moment calculation – 2 Marks

questions.question_text:
Brief about the following isomerism exhibited by the coordination compounds with a suitable example for each.
(i) Ionization
questions.answer: Ionization isomerism - definition with an example – 3 Marks

questions.question_text:
Brief about the following isomerism exhibited by the coordination compounds with a suitable example for each.
(ii) Hydrate
questions.answer: Hydrate isomerism - definition with an example – 3 Marks

questions.question_text:
Brief about the following isomerism exhibited by the coordination compounds with a suitable example for each.
(iii) Geometrical
questions.answer: Geometrical isomerism - definition with an example – 4 Marks

questions.question_text: The UV-Visible spectrum of an octahedral complex showed λmax at 600 nm. Calculate the crystal field splitting energy, Δ₀ and complementary colour of the complex?
questions.answer:
Δ₀ = hc/λ = (6.626x10⁻³⁴ J.s)(3x10⁸cm/s)/(600x10⁻⁹m) = 3.313x10⁻¹⁹ J - 4 Marks
Wavelength of light absorbed is 600 nm (i.e. orange light) and hence the complementary colour of the complex is blue - 2 Marks

questions.question_text: Determine the effective nuclear charge experienced by the 4p electron of Bromine. [Atomic number of Br = 35].
questions.answer:
Slater configuration of Br: (1s²) (2s² 2p⁶) (3s² 3p⁶) (3d¹⁰) (4s² 4p⁵) - 1 Mark
Shielding Constant of 4p=[(10x1)+(18x0.85)+(6x0.35)] = 27.4 - 2 Marks
Effective nuclear charge = 35 - 27.4 = 7.60 - 1 Mark
questions.chapter: Unit 3: Atomic Structure - Effective Nuclear Charge
